alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:38PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sumter County through 615 PM EDT... At 538 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Croxton Crossroads to near Americus to near New Era, and moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Leslie, Andersonville, De Soto, Desoto, Sumter, Lamar, Croxton Crossroads, New Era, Huntington, Pennington, Maddox and Methvins. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
